required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Crinone 8% Intravaginal Gel and IM Progesterone Supplementation for In Vitro Fertilization (IVF)
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Crinone 8% Intravaginal Gel or Intramuscular Progesterone Supplementation for In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) and Embryo Transfer (ET) Cycles in Women Under Age 40 Years Old

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this research study is to compare the pregnancy rates for two different types of progesterone supplementation after in-vitro fertilization (IVF).

detailed_description.textblock: The aim is to test the hypothesis that the pregnancy rates of women under age 40 undergoing an in vitro fertilization and embryo transfer (IVF-ET) cycle are not different with respect to the administration of progesterone (Crinone 8%, intravaginal gel versus intramuscular progesterone).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Pregnant Patients After IVF Treatments
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of pregnant patients after IVF treatments who received either Crinone or IM Progesterone after oocyte retrieval

arm_group.description: Crinone 8% (90 mg of micronized progesterone in a bioadhesive vaginal gel contained in a single use, one piece applicator) once a day beginning the second day following oocyte retrieval (Study Group A) continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or until the 10th week of pregnancy.

Progesterone—50 mg intramuscularly once a day beginning the day after oocyte retrieval continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or if positive, switching to Crinone 8% intravaginal gel until the 10th week of pregnancy.

intervention.description: Crinone 8% (90 mg of micronized progesterone in a bioadhesive vaginal gel contained in a single use, one piece applicator) once a day beginning the second day following oocyte retrieval (Study Group A) continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or until the 10th week of pregnancy.

Progesterone—50 mg intramuscularly once a day beginning the day after oocyte retrieval continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or if positive, switching to Crinone 8% intravaginal gel until the 10th week of pregnancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women of reproductive age (21-39) with infertility who are appropriate candidates for IVF/ET and have an FSH < 15 mIU/ml
- Women 21 to 39 years of age who have been assigned to stimulation of 2 to 8 amps of Luteal Lupron/FSH or Luteal Lupron FSH/HMG.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who have had more than 3 previous IVF/ET cycles

results_reference.citation: Yanushpolsky E, Hurwitz S, Greenberg L, Racowsky C, Hornstein M. Crinone vaginal gel is equally effective and better tolerated than intramuscular progesterone for luteal phase support in in vitro fertilization-embryo transfer cycles: a prospective randomized study. Fertil Steril. 2010 Dec;94(7):2596-9. doi: 10.1016/j.fertnstert.2010.02.033. Epub 2010 Mar 27.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor of Ob/Gyn, BWH and Harvard Medical School

participant_flow.recruitment_details: All patients starting an IVF cycle will receive a letter from their physician and Dr. Yanushpolsky. We will include a copy of the consent form. This letter will briefly describe the study and will have an opt out paragraph. Patients fulfilling inc/exc criteria will be approached on the day of their oocyte retrieval by a study coordinator.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The participant may not qualify for enrollment if there were no eggs fertilized, or no embryos transfered, or all embryos frozen.

group.title: Crinone 8% Vaginal Gel
group.description: Crinone 8% (90 mg of micronized progesterone in a bioadhesive vaginal gel contained in a single use, one piece applicator) once a day beginning the second day following oocyte retrieval (Study Group A) continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or until the 10th week of pregnancy.

group.title: Intramuscular Progesterone
group.description: Progesterone—50 mg intramuscularly once a day beginning the day after oocyte retrieval continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or if positive, switching to Crinone 8% intravaginal gel until the 10th week of pregnancy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Pregnant Patients After IVF Treatments
outcome.description: Percentage of pregnant patients after IVF treatments who received either Crinone or IM Progesterone after oocyte retrieval
outcome.population: Number of participants for analysis was determined by completion of the IVF cycle using the specified medications, either Crinone or IM Progesterone

measure.population: Number of participants for analysis was determined by completion of the IVF cycle using the specified medications, either Crinone or IM Progesterone

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: This was an equivalence comparison. The study was designed to detect a 14% pregnancy difference between the arms with 80% power and one interim analysis using O'Brien-Fleming parameters and an experiment-wise alpha level of 5%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Crinone is the numerator and IM Progesterone is the denominator.

reported_events.time_frame: From day of consent through 6 weeks of participation

group.title: Crinone 8% Vaginal Gel
group.description: Crinone 8% (90 mg of micronized progesterone in a bioadhesive vaginal gel contained in a single use, one piece applicator) once a day beginning the second day following oocyte retrieval (Study Group A) continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or until the 10th week of pregnancy.

group.title: Intramuscular Progesterone
group.description: Progesterone—50 mg intramuscularly once a day beginning the day after oocyte retrieval continuing until the pregnancy test is negative or if positive, switching to Crinone 8% intravaginal gel until the 10th week of pregnancy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
